entries.content: The sales process requires daily discipline and activity, even when you don't feel like it.
Focus on leading indicators in sales, like calls made or conversations started, rather than just lagging indicators like deals closed.
Recognize that sales slumps are normal; the key is how quickly you can break out of them.
Break down large sales goals into smaller, daily or weekly achievable tasks.
Celebrate small wins to build momentum and counteract negative feelings during a slump.
Seek external coaching or accountability partners to help identify blind spots and stay on track.
Maintain a positive self-image and belief in your ability to sell, even after setbacks.
Review past successes and positive feedback to reinforce confidence during challenging times.
Analyze where the sales process is breaking down, rather than just blaming results on external factors.
Understand that consistency in effort often outweighs sporadic bursts of high activity.
Refocus on fundamental sales skills like prospecting, discovery, and closing when experiencing difficulties.
Manage your personal state and energy levels; sales performance is tied to mindset and well-being.
